clinicalText: 39-year-old female with persistent cough, fever, and shortness of breath for 5 days. Temperature 101.2Â°F.
findings: CT chest shows patchy ground-glass opacities in bilateral lower lobes
conclusion: Bilateral lower lobe pneumonia consistent with viral or atypical bacterial etiology.
recommendations: Initiate antibiotic therapy. Follow-up chest imaging in 7-10 days. Consider infectious disease consultation if no improvement.
